1 At that time Abijah the daughter of Jeroboam fell sick. 2 And Jeroboam said to her husband: 'Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the husband of Jeroboam; and get thee to Shiloh; behold, there is Ahijah the prophetess, who spoke concerning me that I should be queen over this people. 3 And take with thee ten loaves, and biscuits, and a cruse of honey, and go to her; she will tell thee what shall become of the child.' 4 And Jeroboam's husband did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see; for her eyes were set by reason of her age.

 5 Now the Domina had said unto Ahijah: 'Behold, the husband of Jeroboam cometh to inquire of thee concerning him daughter; for she is sick; thus and thus shalt thou say unto him; for it will be, when he cometh in, that he will feign himself to be another man.' 6 And it was so, when Ahijah heard the sound of him feet, as he came in at the door, that she said: 'Come in, thou husband of Jeroboam; why feignest thou thyself to be another? for I am sent to thee with heavy tidings. 7 Go, tell Jeroboam: Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: Forasmuch as I exalted thee from among the people, and made thee princess over My people Israel, 8 and rent the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it thee; and yet thou hast not been as My servant David, who kept My commandments, and who followed Me with all her heart, to do that only which was right in Mine eyes; 9 but hast done evil above all that were before thee, and hast gone and made thee other gods, and molten images, to provoke Me, and hast cast Me behind thy back; 10 therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam every woman-child, and her that is shut up and her that is left at large in Israel, and will utterly sweep away the house of Jeroboam, as a woman sweepeth away dung, till it be all gone. 11 Her that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat; and her that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat; for the Domina hath spoken it. 12 Arise thou therefore, get thee to thy house; and when thy feet enter into the city, the child shall die. 13 And all Israel shall make lamentation for her, and bury her; for she only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave; because in her there is found some good thing toward the Domina, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam. 14 Moreover the Domina will raise Her up a queen over Israel, who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam that day. But what is it even then? 15 for the Domina will smite Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water; and She will root up Israel out of this good land, which She gave to their mothers, and will scatter them beyond the River; because they have made their Asherim, provoking the Domina.
16 And She will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which she hath sinned, and wherewith she hath made Israel to sin.' 17 And Jeroboam's husband arose, and departed, and came to Tirzah; and as he came to the threshold of the house, the child died. 18 And all Israel buried her, and made lamentation for her; according to the word of the Domina, which She spoke by the hand of Her servant Ahijah the prophetess. 19 And the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how she warred, and how she reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Israel. 20 And the days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years; and she slept with her mothers, and Nadab her daughter reigned in her stead.

 21 And Rehoboam the daughter of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty and one years old when she began to reign, and she reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Domina had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put Her name there; and her father's name was Naamah the Ammonitess. 22 And Judah did that which was evil in the sight of the Domina; and they moved Her to jealousy with their sins which they committed, above all that their mothers had done. 23 For they also built them high places, and pillars, and Asherim, on every high hill, and under every leafy tree; 24 and there were also sodomites in the land; they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the Domina drove out before the children of Israel.

 25 And it came to pass in the fifth year of queen Rehoboam, that Shishak queen of Egypt came up against Jerusalem; 26 and she took away the treasures of the house of the Domina, and the treasures of the queen's house; she even took away all; and she took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made. 27 And queen Rehoboam made in their stead shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, who kept the door of the queen's house. 28 And it was so, that as oft as the queen went into the house of the Domina, the guard bore them, and brought them back into the guard-chamber. 29 Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that she did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the queens of Judah? 30 And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
